channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Almost a year, 17th July
item.description:
One of those pictures was taken in sept 2024 and the other July 2025. The man hole cover is still there with a hole in it. You said you were waiting for a new cover like it's a custom size when it's just looks like a stand 650 by 450 cover. Putting a cone there doesn't work because, well it's a cone. People move it and it's probably worse to use a cone as it means more dogs go there to pee and the whole idea is to keep dogs away so they don't get their paw caught?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crab Hill, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Zip bikes, 17th July
item.description:
These bikes are all over the park. Some in fields, some in bushes and some in the river. Please remove them. I was under the impression they were blocked for use in the park? I looked on the zip wire and BPP was not within their useable zone yet the lark is full of them. They seem to attract degenerates.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Calverley Close, New Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street Lamp Issue - Light Direction, 17th July
item.description:
I’m writing to report an issue with the street lamp directly opposite my property (109 Kingswood Road). It appears that the angle or direction of the light has shifted, and it is now shining directly into my garden. In the evenings, the glare is so intense that it’s like looking into the sun, and I’m unable to comfortably use part of my garden because of how blinding it is. I believe the lamp may need to be repositioned or adjusted. I’d really appreciate it if someone could come to inspect and resolve the issue. Thank you in advance for your help. Kind regards, Lisa Brailsford

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kingswood Road, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rosendale Road SE21 south west corner o, 16th July
item.description:
Rosendale Road SE21 south west corner of Park Hall Road (ie BT phone exchange corner) junction yellow plastic grit bin multi tagged. Please forward fixmystreet.com report to your contractor for pictures and Google Streetview link: https://www.google.com/maps/@51.4355865,-0.0937613,3a,33.2y,197.17h,80.83t/data=!3m7!1e1!3m5!1sZnyXdSOJHS5rhyuhaLUr-g!2e0!6shttps:%2F%2Fstreetviewpixels-pa.googleapis.com%2Fv1%2Fthumbnail%3Fcb_client%3Dmaps_sv.tactile%26w%3D900%26h%3D600%26pitch%3D9.172401253959833%26panoid%3DZnyXdSOJHS5rhyuhaLUr-g%26yaw%3D197.16740632622506!7i16384!8i8192?entry=ttu&g_ep=EgoyMDI1MDcxMy4wIKXMDSoASAFQAw%3D%3D

item.title: Along my Rd still not swept correctly or properly or been done at all., 16th July
item.description:
Feedback@haringey.gov.uk Today's date is the 16th of July, 2025. Rochelle Cassell Feedback & Resolutions Officer Feedback & Resolutions Team Today's date is the 16th of July 2025. Hi from Mr Webster. 5th e-mail about the same problem. No help from Harringay Council. Another copy to fix my street. flashing outside on top of a easement / conjoining porch the property at #41 which is next door to me has the same problem going on because it is conjoined and it's going to need urgent attention very soon because it's letting in water

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dorset Road, West Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet
